short_summary: Construction and installation of floating docks in Cap aux Meules fishing harbour
description: The scope of work includes construction and installation of floating docks and accessories, as well as supply and install HDPE dry boxes, and delivery and installation of floating docks and accessories in Cap aux Meules fishing harbour. The contractor must also lodge Marine Liability Insurance prior to commencement of work, if required. The expected contract start date is November 6, 2023, and the expected contract end date is March 31, 2024.
full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement

**Business Opportunity**

Construction and Installation of Floating Docks in Cap aux Meules Fishing Harbour
================userInfo(Opendots

### Government Institution

Contacting Entity (Contractor)

*   **Government Institution Name:** Fisheries and Oceans Canada
*   **Government Institution Address:**
    *   301 Bishop Drive
    *   Fredericton, New Brunswick
    *   E3C 2M6, Canada

### Tender Details

*   **Tender Reference:** 30004998
*   **Publication Date:** October 17, 2023
*   **Tender Closing Date:** November 7, 2023 13:00:00 (Local Time)
*   **Amendment Date:** November 7, 2023
*   **Expected Contract Start Date:** November 6, 2023
*   **Expected Contract End Date:** March 31, 2024
*   **Tender Status:** Expired
*   **Procurement Method:** Competitive – Open Bidding
*   **Selection Criteria:** Lowest Price
*   **Trade Agreements:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

### Project Summary

The contract involves the construction and installation of floating docks and accessories in the Cap aux Meules fishing harbour. The project includes:

*   Construction of CCA wooden floating docks and accessories
*   Supply of materials and specialized labor for the installation of HDPE dry boxes
*   Delivery and installation of floating docks and accessories
*   Complete installation of the floating docks, cables, and strong arms

### Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business

This is an open tender, however, it will be conditionally set-aside under the Government of Canada’s Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB) if two or more bids have been received by Indigenous businesses who are certified under the PSIB criteria and who may be listed in the Government of Canada’s Indigenous Business Directory.

### Contact Information

To obtain more information about this tender opportunity, please contact:

*   **Contact Name:** Karen Dolan
*   **Contact Email:** [DFO.tenders-soumissions.MPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca](mailto:DFO.tenders-soumissions.MPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca)
*   **Contact Phone:** (782) 377-7245
*   **Contact Fax:** None
